definition: life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: But credit is the lifeblood of the car business.
sentences.chinese: 但信贷的确是汽车产业的命根子。

sentences.english: The boy is the lifeblood of his parents.
sentences.chinese: 这男孩是他父母的命根子。

sentences.english: And Barr said, 'I'm gonna stick my penis in that thing.'
sentences.chinese: 而巴尔说，‘我要把我的命根子插到那东西里。’

sentences.english: These words hit at the core of him .
sentences.chinese: 这话仿佛一拳打中了他的命根子。

sentences.english: The whole internet knowing we've got a small penis.
sentences.chinese: 如果网上所有人都知道我们的命根子很小。

sentences.english: Enthusiasm is the lifeblood of creativity.

definition: lifeblood/the thing that one cherishes most in life/(coll.) family jewels (male genitals)
precious darling (often refers to one's child)/sweetheart
(of a child) apple of one's eye
cannot maintain (sth)/unable to keep/more likely than not/may well
to die without progeny/(offensive) may you die childless/may you be the last of your family line
to waste/to defile/to abuse/to insult/to defile/to trample on/to wreck/also pr. [zao1 ta5]
